passage_text: With the advent of the Internet, the point-of-presence came to be identified with switches and routers that allowed users to establish a connection to the World Wide Web.

A point of presence was a location where a long-distance carrier (IXC) could terminate services and provide connections into a local telephone network (LATA). An Internet point of presence is an access point to the Internet. It is a physical location that houses servers, routers, ATM switches and digital/analog call aggregators.
A point of presence (PoP) is an artificial demarcation point OR interface point between communicating entities.

Definition of point of presence (POP) in The Network Encyclopedia. point of presence (POP) The local access point for an Internet service provider (ISP). A point of presence (POP) consists of the high-speed telecommunications equipment and technologies that enable users to connect to the Internet via their ISP.
A point-of-presence, often referred to as a POP, is the physical location where two or more types of communication devices establish a connection.
Network. AccessKenya's Point of Presence (POP) is located in a data centre of one of the world's largest Internet Carriers (Tier 1) also known as a carrier of carriers in North America.
Point of Presence. AccessKenya's Point of Presence (POP) is located in a data centre of one of the world's largest Internet Carriers (Tier 1) also known as a carrier of carriers in North America.
